title: Installation issue: openmpi with intel compiler with specific gcc module
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue
Set up modules.yaml for Intel compiler and put there some gcc as a module:
```
compilers:
  - compiler:
    spec: intel@19.0.4
    paths:
      cc: /opt/cluster.2019.4-intel-tgd5yn/bin/icc
      cxx: /optcluster.2019.4-intel-tgd5yn/bin/icpc
      f77: /opt/cluster.2019.4-intel-tgd5yn/bin/ifort
      fc: /opt/cluster.2019.4-intel-tgd5yn/bin/ifort
    flags: {}
    operating_system: centos7
    target: x86_64
    modules: [gcc/gcc-8.3.0-gcc-4.8.5-6ypggms]
    environment:
      unset: []
    extra_rpaths: []
```

Then try to compile openmpi with that. It results in:
```
==> Installing openmpi
==> No binary for openmpi found: installing from source
==> openmpi: Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> openmpi: Executing phase: 'configure'
==> Error: JSONDecodeError: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)

/cvmfs/software.metacentrum.cz/software_basics/spack/0.15/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/openmpi/package.py:618, in configure_args:
        615                self.compiler.cc_rpath_arg + path
        616                for path in itertools.chain(
        617                    self.compiler.extra_rpaths,
  >>    618                    self.compiler.implicit_rpaths())])
        619        else:
        620            config_args.append('--disable-wrapper-rpath')
        621

See build log for details: ...
```

### Information on your system
```
Singularity> spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.15.3
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-centos7-haswell
```

### Additional information

I have openmpi package slightly customized so the line numbers maybe differ. But the changes are not the source of actual bug report.
